title: Unfair ranked matchmaking
body:
See Here: http://i.imgur.com/42rQgD1.png

How is this fair ranked matchmaking? I'm in my first 10 games of ranked and for some reason they put me with a bunch of people who don't know how to play. They only have 100 wins, how are they expected to know how to play? They are all unranked yet the other team has a gold and two silvers...

Every single lane fed except for mine. Even if Riot expected me to help the team out because I'm more experienced, there is no way I could help all three lanes at once, and then stop my jungle from feeding somehow.

I just don't really understand what the point here was, it seems too specific for this to just be bad luck, I got stuck with a bunch of newbies.

And just to make things worse, our reksai went AFK anyway.

replies.body: Unranked is basically silver, and the guy in gold has trash MMR. Simple as that.
Click on a summoners name, it will show the MMr for each side. If the mmr is close which it wiil be then you have nothing to go on about. Regardless of rank.
that heimer kda rofl, to be fair you're going against pretty low elos anyway
I've only won one ranked game. How does that place me with them?

your placements you're put with elo you're estimated at with your current w/l in the season. the more you lose the lower ranks youll vs.
the better you play the higher you'll vs. if you can't win then eventually you'll vs low enough to win
